headline: Waldorf Goat Cheese Salad
description: Red leaf lettuce tossed with raspberry walnut vinaigrette and topped with grapes, pecans, and goat cheese.
name: Waldorf Goat Cheese Salad
recipeIngredient: 2 cups red leaf lettuce - rinsed, dried and torn

recipeInstructions.text: Toss lettuce with dressing in a mixing bowl; transfer to a serving dish. Scatter grapes, goat cheese, and pecans on top, and enjoy!

review.reviewBody: Absolutely the BEST Waldorf Salad! My family asks for it every year during the holidays . . . and any other time they think about it! :-)
Good salad. Made it according to the directions except I used spinach instead of the lettuce called for. Not a fan of red leaf lettuce. It was not as pretty but still very good.
Very good salad. Great summer fare.
I added an apple. We loved the fruit and cheese combo.
Great salad. Refreshing, tasty and easy to make.

Wow!! Fantastic combination of tastes! My daughter and I made this for a dinner party she was having for her birthday. She wanted something different, festive and good. This fit the bill!! Made it using the ingredients as listed and used Newman's Own Lite Raspberry and Walnut dressing. Amazingly good, and looks gorgeous!

This salad is delicious. I used the kraft raspberry vinaigrette which was just as good. I brought it to my family's Thanksgiving dinner and got many compliments! I cut the grapes in four pieces and used a lot of pecans. You can't go wrong with this one!

Best salad I've ever made, hands down. All the flavors are just perfect together.
I used a Raspberry Acai Vinaigrette and it was the bomb.
I'm not a fan of walnuts so I did sliced almonds. Delicious!
i didn't have grapes but a green apple was terrific. and definitely toast the pecans, it makes the flavor even better.

Very good salad. I added grilled chicken breast strips. It is essential that a great dressing is used. I prefer a homemade vinaigrette. I also think blue cheese crumbles give the salad more 'kick', than goat cheese.
best salad ever, so fresh and easy... perfect!
Made my own raspberry vinaigrette, used roasted pears and baby spinach. We liked it a lot - my daughter introduced us to goat cheese and it has become a favorite salad "fixing".
Salad was very good and yes it is all up to the dressing that you choose. Not quite sure why Waldorf is in the name as it has nothing to do with apples and celery.

This recipe is highly dependent on the vinaigrette you choose, so make sure to get one you like. I'm not real crazy about the bottled raspberry-walnut dressings I've tried (too sweet and 'walnutty'), so I used a regular rasperry vinaigrette and added a couple drops of balsamic and walnut oil. The red lettuce/red grape/goat cheese/pecan combination is beauty! I toasted my pecans for a few minutes at 350. Thanks!
This is fantastic! i couldn't find raspberry walnut vinigrette so i used just low fat raspberry. SO YUMMY! and healthy too. i will make this again for sure!
Yummy and super easy!
This is so easy to make and the flavors put together are outstanding!
Yummy! I added a tad more goat cheese because I love it. Next time I will probably make my own dressing. This is just a simple, tasty salad. Thanks!

This salad rocks your taste buds.
Give it a try for yourself or try it on your friends first.
